pre_attack: What are the penalties for theft under Singapore law?
Punishment for theft 379. Whoever commits theft shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to 3 years, or with fine, or with both.

No prosecution against the Minister or any police officer or officer, sailor, soldier or airman in the Singapore Armed Forces for any act purporting to be done under this Division may be instituted in any criminal court except with the sanction of the President, and(a) no police officer acting under this Division in good faith;(b) no commissioned officer acting under section 61 in goodfaith;(c) no person doing any act in good faith in compliance with a requisition under section 58 or 60; and (d) no inferior officer, sailor, soldier or airman or member of the Singapore Armed Forces doing any act in obedience to any order which under naval, military or air force law he orshe was bound to obey,

Application of Chapter 7 to Singapore Police Force140B. The provisions of this Chapter relating to offences committed in relation to members of the Singapore Armed Forces or any visiting forces lawfully present in Singapore shall apply, with the necessary modifications, to similar acts committed in relation to members of the Singapore Police Force or any volunteer, auxiliary or special force attached to, or coming under the jurisdiction of, that Force.CHAPTER 8OFFENCES RELATING TOUNLAWFUL ASSEMBLYUnlawful assembly141. An assembly of 5 or more persons is designated an “unlawful assembly", if the common object of the persons composing thatassembly is —

According to the Penal Code 1871.pdf, specifically Section 379-382, which is listed as a Specified Offence Deemed To Be Committed In Singapore in The Schedule (Section 4B), the penalty for theft under Singapore law includes: ##2$$

* Imprisonment ##7$$
* Fine not exceeding $2,000 ##1$$

Additionally, according to Section 225 of the Penal Code 1871.pdf, if no special punishment is provided by the law for such commission or omission, a person who commits an offence against laws in force in Singapore shall be punished with fine not exceeding $2,000.

The answer you are looking for is not found in the knowledge base!

However, based on related information from Penal Code 1871.pdf (Document: Penal Code 1871.pdf), it appears that there might be some relevant sections regarding punishment. 

Section "225 Offences against laws of Singapore where no specialpunishment is provided" mentions a general provision for punishments when no specific law provides otherwise ##2$$.

Additionally, Section "[15/2019]THE SCHEDULESection 4B(2) and (3)SPECIFIED OFFENCES DEEMED TO BE COMMITTED IN SINGAPORE1. Communicating false information of harmful thing under section 268A" lists various specified offences deemed to be committed in Singapore ##3$$.

However, there is no explicit mention of the penalties for theft specifically.
